sense.def:
To pull something
pomeni nekaj čvrsto držati in premikati proti sebi.

seg.quote: She pulled Paul's hair so hard that he yelled.
I shut my eyes when I pulled the trigger.
He hoisted the rope over the branch and pulled with all his strength.

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo, žival ali človek
pulls a cart or piece of machinery
, je pritrjen na voz ali stroj oziroma ga drži, tako da se premika skupaj z njim.

To pull a part of one's body in a particular direction
pomeni na silo premakniti del telesa v določeno smer.

seg.quote: ‘Let go of me,’ she said, and pulled her arm savagely out of his grasp.

sense.def:
To pull oneself out of a place
pomeni držati se nečesa in uporabiti moč, da premaknemo svoje telo iz nekega prostora ali kraja.

seg.quote: Ralph pulled himself out of the water.

sense.def:
To pull a curtain or blind
pomeni premakniti zaveso ali žaluzijo prek okna, tako da ga zakrijemo ali odkrijemo.

seg.quote: She closed the window and pulled the blind.

sense.def:
To pull something apart
ali
to pull something to pieces
pomeni iz nečesa narediti več delov, ki jih bo težko ali nemogoče spet sestaviti v celoto.

seg.quote: If you pull apart one of the calculators, you won't get it back together again.
Try and stop the cat pulling the Christmas tree to bits.

sense.def:
To pull people
pomeni pridobiti si podporo ali zbuditi zanimanje ljudi;

seg.quote: He was interested in the number of voters she would pull.

sense.def:
To pull a muscle
pomeni poškodovati si mišico, ker jo preveč obremenimo.

To pull people or animals apart
pomeni s silo ločiti ljudi ali živali, ki se tepejo.

seg.quote: I rushed in and tried to pull the dogs apart.

sense.def:
To pull at something
pomeni nekaj držati in premikati proti sebi, potem pa spustiti.

seg.quote: ‘Come home now, Jim,’ she said, pulling at his sleeve.

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo
pulls away
, se začne premikati.

seg.quote: As the lights changed, I pulled away.

sense.def:
To pull away from someone
pomeni sunkovito se odmakniti od nekoga, ki nas drži.

seg.quote: He tried to kiss her, but she pulled away fiercely.

sense.def:
To pull down a building
pomeni namerno uničiti stavbo, da bi na njenem mestu lahko zgradili drugo.

seg.quote: Why did they pull those houses down?

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo
pulls in somewhere
, se nekje ustavi.

seg.quote: The London train pulled in to the station.

sense.def:
To pull off one's clothes
pomeni hitro odstraniti oblačila.

seg.quote: He pulled off his shirt.

sense.def:
To pull on one's clothes
pomeni hitro si nadeti oblačila.

seg.quote: He started to pull on his shorts.

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo
pulls out from a place
, se začne premikati od nekod.

seg.quote: The train pulled out of the station.

sense.def:
To pull out of an activity or agreement
pomeni odločiti se, da ne bomo več sodelovali v neki dejavnosti ali dogovoru.

seg.quote: You pay a 10% deposit which you lose if you pull out before completion.
He pulled his party out of the coalition.

sense.def:
Kadar vojska
pulls out of a place
, zapusti neki kraj.

seg.quote: Troops had begun to pull out of the area.
The Prime Minister intended to pull them out soon.

sense.def:
Kadar vozilo
pulls over
, se približa zemljišču ob robu ceste in se ustavi.

seg.quote: Pull over, Oliver. Stop the car.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
pulls through a serious illness
ali kadar zdravnik
pulls someone through
, po hudi bolezni tisti človek okreva.

seg.quote: I think she'll pull through.

sense.def:
Kadar ljudje
pull together
, pri nekem opravilu ali v nekih okoliščinah delujejo složno.

seg.quote: We all pulled together during the war.

sense.def:
‘Pull yourself together’
rečemo nekomu, ki je razburjen in jezen, mi pa bi radi, da se obvlada in umiri.

Kadar vozilo
pulls up
, zmanjša hitrost in se ustavi.

seg.quote: The rain stopped as we pulled up at the hotel.

sense.def:
To pull up a chair
pomeni premakniti stol bliže k nečemu ali nekomu.

seg.quote: I pulled up a chair and sat down to watch the news.
